text:
Jan Ferdynand Olszewski (20 August 1930 in Warsaw – 7 February 2019 in Warsaw) was a Polish lawyer and political figure. He is best known for serving as Prime Minister of the Republic of Poland from 1991 to 1992.
Olszewski died after a long illness on 7 February 2019 in a Warsaw hospital, aged 88.

annotations.surface_form: Prime Minister of the Republic of Poland
